duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and direct multiple projects under the guidance of Project Management Office (PMO) leadership.
Identify and document project requirements, support clients on various information security initiatives, and manage issues to resolution.
Responsible for all aspects of the project over the entire life cycle with a focus on project risk management, forecasting challenges, and devising strategies to overcome them.
Drive project progress across multiple stakeholders and levels of oversight, ensuring timely and effective resource utilization.
Develop strategic project delivery plans, detailed schedules, project controls, cost forecasting, risk management, issues forecast and resolution planning, and daily task management.
Monitor the project budget, milestones, and deliverables to ensure timely completion and uninterrupted progress.

Report project performance metrics and status reports to internal and external stakeholders and the PMO. Coordinate and manage projects across various functional groups, communicating potential risks and impacts.
Establish communication plans to facilitate core project team coordination and provide status updates to management and extended project team members.
Implement project management controls to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet customer expectations.
Maintain strong and seamless relationships by maintaining communications about the project to the team, clients, and delivery personnel.
Collaborate with peers during project execution to track dependencies, project issues, and potential risks.
Consolidate and report project performance metrics and status reports to internal and external stakeholders and the PMO.

education_certification.credential: BA or BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field. Advanced degree is desirable. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification strongly preferred.
